forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West wind around 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 16 to 25 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the day unfolds beneath an azure sky, casting a warm glow on the city as the sun approaches its afternoon zenith. While the temperature is carried northward toward a modest 64 degrees, the gentle, persistent breeze from the west whispers through the streets, reminding all of the city’s unique climate. As the day wanes, expect a transition; the forecast hints at the emergence of patchy drizzle after the witching hour, along with a wrap of soft clouds that may cloak the stars, inviting a night of introspection.

If you find yourself venturing out, dress lightly, yet be prepared with a light jacket, as the brisk winds may flirt with a chill reminiscent of the fog that tends to roll in lazily along the Bay. The visibility may shift as the twilight deepens, but until dark claims the horizon, the sun’s rays will brighten the pathways and parks, a serene invitation to stroll along the waterfront or enjoy a relaxed afternoon in a local café, perhaps lost in a novel or the gentle hum of conversation. With the prospect of an evening drizzle, plan for that cozy retreat—a warm cup in hand as the city settles into the embrace of night.
